timeline.title: Foundations of an Icon
timeline.description: Gustave Eiffel's vision begins to take shape as the massive iron foundations are laid in the Champ de Mars, amidst significant public skepticism from the Parisian artistic elite.
timeline.visualPrompt: The construction site of the Eiffel Tower base, massive iron legs rising, cranes and 19th-century laborers, sepia tone.

timeline.title: Universal Exposition
timeline.description: The tower is inaugurated as the centerpiece of the 1889 World's Fair, standing as the tallest man-made structure in the world, dazzling visitors with its modern engineering.
timeline.visualPrompt: The completed Eiffel Tower at the 1889 World's Fair, crowds in period clothing, flags and festive atmosphere.

timeline.title: Wren's Reconstruction
timeline.description: Following the Great Fire of London, Sir Christopher Wren begins work on his masterpiece, a testament to the city's resilience and the English Baroque style.
timeline.visualPrompt: St Paul's Cathedral under construction, scaffolding surrounding the nascent dome, 17th-century London skyline.

timeline.title: The London Blitz
timeline.description: The Cathedral stands tall amidst the smoke and destruction of World War II, becoming a powerful symbol of British hope and survival during the intense bombing of the city.
timeline.visualPrompt: St Paul's dome surrounded by smoke and fire from the Blitz, searchlights in the night sky.
